net.hudup.core.data

Class ServerPointer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.data.AbstractDataset
      • net.hudup.core.data.Pointer
        • net.hudup.core.data.ServerPointer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Dataset

    public class ServerPointer
extends Pointer
    There are two typical Dataset such as Snapshot and Scanner. Snapshot or scanner is defined as an image of piece of Dataset and knowledge base (KBase) at certain time point. This image is stored in share memory for fast access because it takes long time to access data and knowledge stored in hard disk. The difference between Snapshot and Scanner that Snapshot copies whole piece of data into memory while scanner is merely a reference to such data piece. Snapshot consumes much more memory but gives faster access and is more convenient. Snapshot and Scanner are read-only objects because they provide only read operator.
    Another additional Dataset is Pointer. Pointer does not contain any information nor provide any access means to dataset. It only points to another Snapshot, Scanner, or KBase.
    Although you can create your own Dataset, Dataset is often retrieved from utility class parsers that implement interface DatasetParser. Snapshot is retrieved from SnapshotParser. Scanner is retrieved from ScannerParser. Both SnapshotParser and ScannerParser implement interface DatasetParser. Pointer is retrieved from Indicator. Indicator is DatasetParser specified to create Pointer.

    Therefore, this class is called server pointer, which is also a pointer. It neither is server nor contains any information about server but it points to another server.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
